text: is there anything more delicious and
comforting than meatballs I can think of
only one thing
meatballs with fresh mozzarella this
recipe is super delicious and easy and
it starts of course with the meat I'm
using a pound of ground pork and a pound
of 85% lean ground beef that's the chuck
beef to that a cup of coarsely ground
fresh breadcrumbs 2 large eggs you don't
even have to whisk the eggs first that's
how easy this recipe really is and then
cheese cheese please this is 1/2 a cup
of finely ground pecorino romano
if you already have parmesan in your
fridge use that it's perfectly fine and
for aromatics one clove of garlic
smashed it with the side of your knife
first to make it easier and then finally
mince okay that can go in and the
parsley
you'll want about a quarter cup in here
into the bowl it goes 1 and 1/2
teaspoons here of course salt and gently
folding everything together a key here
is to not overwork the meat as you're
combining it and you just want to look
to see that the breadcrumbs and the
parsley and the cheese are all evenly
distributed and of course that the eggs
have broken down
those are your binder so they're
important here this is looking terrific
put these on to a little tray lined with
parchment and have a little bowl of
water the water is helpful to keep the
meat from sticking to your hands so just
give a dip get the poem's nice and wet
and then sort of cup your one hand and
kind of work it this way and what this
does is it gives you that meatball shape
but you're not actually pressing the
meat at all or smashing it together and
this is going to give you a really light
airy fluffy meatball with a nice crusty
exterior from the searing and look you
have a beautiful little meatball just
like that and you can feel that it's
nice and light just carry on in this
manner until they're all made ok I'm
gonna wash up a bit here and then we're
ready to start cooking I have a pan
preheating over medium high heat
anytime you're searing no matter what it
is the key is to preheat the pan
otherwise you're not gonna get that good
crust and it might stick also this gets
2 tablespoons of
extra-virgin olive oil just wait for the
oil to shimmer in the pan that will just
take a few seconds if the pan is nice
and hot and these go right in should
hear a good sizzle when it goes down the
pans crowded the meat will steam rather
than sear so it looks like I have room
here to get all of these in now these
will need about 10 minutes to brown let
them hang out on the pan undisturbed for
at least two to three minutes and then
you can sort of start turning them and
checking for that nice dark brown crust
I think it's time to take a peek at one
of these meatballs
yes that's gorgeous see that nice color
there tells me we're ready to start
flipping these guys these will probably
need to be turned two or three times to
get nice browning all over lift these
out gently because everything happens in
this one pot there's very little cleanup
and we're just building flavor upon
flavor in here next up right into the
pot goes 1/2 of a finely chopped small
onion and stir it around that's gonna
help pick up all of those brown bits at
the bottom of this pan to these onions a
pinch of red pepper flakes I love these
things it gives a gentle heat next up is
a can of whole peeled plum tomatoes in
juice those go right in just put them in
a blender and puree them and stir that
about to incorporate the onions and
reduce for a few minutes just until it's
thickened slightly and then whole basil
leaves in here just stir those in those
meatballs go back in now these have been
simmering for about 10 minutes just give
them one turn and let them simmer on the
other side for about 10 minutes and
they'll be cooked through as these cook
they're soaking up that wonderful tomato
sauce and taking on even more flavor now
the piece de resistance the mozzarella
evenly distribute your thin slices of
mozzarella right over the top and it
melts wonderfully under the broiler to
finish this off only needs two to three
minutes under there just until it's
melted and bubbly and golden brown in a
few places
when this meatball casserole comes out
of the oven there will be no reason to
ring a dinner bell everyone's gonna be
at the table ready to eat happy eating
